thread.title: Kenya: Kenyans Blamed for 'Cheap' China Imports
thread.title_full: Kenya: Kenyans Blamed for 'Cheap' China Imports

title: Kenya: Kenyans Blamed for 'Cheap' China Imports
text:
Kenyans Blamed for 'Cheap' China Imports Tagged: Kenya: State Dismisses Reports on Nairobi Lockdown for Obama's Visit By Martin Mwita 
KENYAN traders focus on cheap low margin goods from China that sell quickly, a Chinese trade delegation said yesterday. 
This, the team said, has led to accusations that Chinese manufacturers produce low quality goods specifically for the African market yet it is the importers who seek low priced products which are of lower standard. 
The delegation said Chinese manufactures continue to take advantage of the low purchasing power of majority of Kenyans which has seen low priced good flood the local market. Related Topics Kenya: State Dismisses Reports on Nairobi Lockdown for Obama's Visit 
These include electronics, mobile phones, and stationery among others. 
Speaking during the China Trade week which opened in Nairobi yesterday, the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade said Chinese manufactures make quality products. 
"Chinese products are of good quality and fair price. Kenyan products such as tea are also enjoying high reputation in China," CCPIT deputy director general Wu Yanguang said. 
MIE Group, an exhibition, trading and consulting organisation behind the Nairobi event blamed Kenyan traders for sourcing cheap products. 
"It is your responsibility to decide what is the quality you require for the product you want to sell in your home market," said MIE international director Gary Robinson. 
According to Robinson, China manufactures any quality of product needed by the markets. 
"If you choose on specification of your product which is very low and you expect a low price rate, then you can't expect it to be durable and long lasting. China can produce just any quality depending on what you want," he said. Kenya
